description: Scientists say samples from Milan and Turin showed virus traces long before cases were confirmed.
title: Coronavirus was already in Italy by December, waste water study finds
title_page: Coronavirus was already in Italy by December, waste water study finds - BBC News
maintext: Italy's first known non-imported virus case was a patient in the town of Codogno in the Lombardy region. The town was closed off and declared a "red zone" on 21 February. Nine other towns in Lombardy and neighbouring Veneto followed and the entire country went into lockdown in early March.
